ranked_diseases.explanation: Classic triad of multiple cafe-au-lait spots, freckling (especially axillary/inguinal), and plexiform neurofibromas is pathognomonic for NF1. All three major features are present in this patient.
Rare variant of neurofibromatosis that can present with cafe-au-lait spots and neurofibromas, but typically has later onset and less severe manifestations than NF1.
Presents with multiple cafe-au-lait spots and freckling similar to NF1, but typically lacks neurofibromas. The presence of plexiform neurofibroma makes this less likely.
Can present with cafe-au-lait spots, but these are typically large with irregular borders. Lacks freckling and neurofibromas, and usually has endocrine abnormalities.
Combines features of NF1 (cafe-au-lait spots, freckling, neurofibromas) with Noonan syndrome features. Patient data doesn't mention Noonan features but cannot be excluded.
